page.title: 12Domestic Life in Niton 1985
page.content: I housekeep for a family of six. I do washing in a twin tub machine-some people have automatic washing machines and tumble driers. I vacuum clean the floors, then prepare a meal or bake cakes.We have a solid fuel Aga,others cook by electricity,or calor gas (there is no mains gas in Niton) and micro wave ovens are increasingly popular.We have a refrigerator and freezer and freeze some vegetables from the garden.Sometimes I shop at the local shops(2 grocery,1 Post Office, 1butcher 1chemist) but it's cheaper to go to a big supermarket such as Tescos, near Ryde. There are many ready prepared foods(tinned, frozen or dried) available in the shops. The milkman delivers every day except Sunday. To buy clothes or furniture we have to go to Newport, or buy through mail order catalogues.
